paper_title: Deep learning accelerated phase prediction of refractory multi-principal element alloys

claims.claim: Over 0.8 of Ti alloys with simultaneous BCC, B2, and Laves phases that fail exact-match classification differ by at most one phase label from the true phase labels of their nearest Ti-free neighbors, identified using Euclidean distance in the feature space
instruction: The notebook loads the trained MLP model and the testing dataset, performs multi-label phase prediction, and filters test samples that exhibit simultaneous BCC, B2, and Laves phases but fail exact-match classification
The notebook then loads the training dataset from fold 1 and identifies, for each falsely classified Ti alloys, its nearest Ti-free neighbor using Euclidean distance in the normalized feature space

For each falsely classified Ti alloy, compare its predicted phase-label vector with the ground-truth phase-label vector of its nearest Ti-free neighbor and compute the number of differing phase labels
Verify that at least 80% of these samples have 0 or 1 mismatch
